definition: shrapnel/splinter from shell
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
disk/sheet

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: He was wounded in both legs and severely peppered with shrapnel.
sentences.chinese: 他兩條腿都掛彩了，人也被如雨的彈片炸成重傷。

sentences.english: Some still have pellets under healed skin.
sentences.chinese: 一些人癒合的皮膚下還殘留著彈片。

sentences.english: They were hanged up bad, severe lacerations, amputees, a lot of shrapnel.
sentences.chinese: 嚴重的爆炸造成嚴重傷亡，截肢，很多彈片。

sentences.english: Surgeons at Balad had removed the shrapnel-pierced part of his left frontal lobe.
sentences.chinese: 在巴拉德，醫生取出了穿入他左額葉的彈片。

sentences.english: and the fragmentation, commonly known as shrapnel.
sentences.chinese: 以及通常由彈片構成的碎片傷害。

sentences.english: Khalil's head is bandaged with a bloody patch where he took a piece of shrapnel.
sentences.chinese: 哈利勒的頭部被彈片擊中，包紮着被鮮血染紅的繃帶。

sentences.english: Dhao said, adding that he was struck by shrapnel again and fell unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 隨後他又被彈片擊中，接着失去了知覺。

sentences.english: My body was full of shrapnel and my hands had been badly burned.
sentences.chinese: 我的身體上嵌滿了彈片，而我的雙手也被嚴重燒傷。

sentences.english: Shrapnel zings by, slices my throat.
sentences.chinese: 彈片呼嘯而過，把我的喉嚨割破。

sentences.english: A shell splinter embedded itself in the wall.
There’s also my little boy, who ended up with bullets and shrapnel in his hands, and then there’s the elder one, Junior.
sentences.chinese: 還有我的二兒子，他手上留有子彈和彈片。

sentences.english: Using a finger to resist shrapnel tail light press reset.
sentences.chinese: 用手指頂住彈片尾部輕按可復位。

sentences.english: Lubricating and cleaning spindle coned disk spring .
sentences.chinese: 主軸的碟形彈片的潤滑與清潔。

sentences.english: The backward escape of gases or cartridge fragments when a gun is fired.
sentences.chinese: 槍發射時，氣體或彈片的向後泄出。

sentences.english: He had shrapnel up to the knee, his ankle was severed and his instep was blown off.
sentences.chinese: 他的膝蓋中了彈片，踝關節被切斷，腳背被炸飛了。

sentences.english: The interior of the barricade was so strewn with torn cartridges that one would have said that there had been a snowstorm.
sentences.chinese: 街壘的內部撒滿炸開的彈片，就象下了一場雪。

definition: to cremate
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
warp/line of longitude/meridian (geography)
human organ
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
lingering fear
to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
to cast (molten metal)/to mold
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
